lead_paragraph: The museum says a curator was wrong to uninvite “Under the Sun,” a documentary denounced by North Korea for its depiction of that country’s image control.

headline.print_headline: MoMA Rues Canceling Documentary  on N. Korea
headline.main: MoMA Apologizes for Dropping a Film Critical of North Korea

snippet: The museum says a curator was wrong to uninvite “Under the Sun,” a documentary denounced by North Korea for its depiction of that country’s image control.
abstract: Museum of Modern Art concedes it unjustly dropped Under the Sun, Vitaly Mansky's controversial documentary about North Korea, from 2016 Doc Fortnight festival; decision was made by curator who feared reprisals similar to what Sony Pictures suffered after releasing film The Interview.
